text: Michael Carroll is an American writer who published his debut short story collection, Little Reef, in 2014."Little Reef and Other Stories". New York Journal of Books. The collection, which portrays characters that, according to the UW Press, are "people stunned by the shock of the now, who have forgotten their pasts and can’t envision a future". The book was a shortlisted nominee for the Lambda Literary Award for Gay Fiction at the 27th Lambda Literary Awards"The 27th Annual Lambda Literary Award Finalists". Lambda Literary Foundation, March 4, 2015. and won the Sue Kaufman Prize for First Fiction from the American Academy of Arts and Letters.https://artsandletters.org/pressrelease/2015-literature-award-winners/ His short stories also appeared in Ontario Review, Boulevard and The New Penguin Book of Gay Short Stories."Michael Carroll: On His New Short Story Collection, the Benefits of a Spare Writing Style, and His Literary Inspirations". Lambda Literary Foundation, July 2, 2014. Originally from Jacksonville, Florida,Andrew Holleran, "What Michael Carroll Writes About When He Writes About Writers". Interview. he has been the partner of writer Edmund White since 1995.
